job_title: Youth Transitional Worker in Edmonton, AB
pros: Good staff team flexible with shifts

job_title: Family Support Worker in Edmonton, AB
pros: Working with clients who are immigrants and with children 5 yrs and. younger
cons: leadership can contradict what they say

pros: Coworkers (most of them) were pretty great. The youth truly need the help and being apart of their journey is the whole purpose I overlooked the reviews and worked here... if my work with them helped guide them on a more positive path then I consider that a major pro.
cons: Seriously where to start?! Please just take the MANY reviews into consideration before deciding to work here. If you are looking for a job where you want to help people - do yourself the biggest favor and seek other opportunities. There are countless other non profit organizations in Edmonton that care about its service users and employees where you can work. E4C is not it - management dosnt care about the youth in the programs, they are not trauma informed, do not care about employee burn out, lie to employees, talk poorly about front line staff, and have the mentality that firing employees who don't fit in or treating the ones that don't poorly is an acceptable way to run an organization that prides itself on "harm reduction". The only way to reduce harm is to improve, and after years I doubt that will ever happen.

pros: Good benefits, fair pay, that's about it.
cons: Really poor upper management, they only care about themselves and not their employees. They impose strict and arbitrary rules that make no sense and ignore their employees when they question those rules.

pros: Office is in an old school building and the people ar nice
cons: Too many changes all the time. No one really sticks around

pros: Able to work and create change for low-income and vulnerable Edmontonians.
cons: Chronically understaffed departments, lack of accountability by staff and clients, almost no communication between departments. High level of staffing turnover (entire HR department resigned in Summer 2022)

review_title: Little to no support from upper management
pros: Amazing population to work with and serve
cons: No support to move up, sometimes education doesn't give you a better position, just experience and knowing someone will get you a position without deserving or earning it.

review_title: Learned a lot, could not stay.
pros: They are willing to take a chance on people, you learn a lot on the job
cons: Management is hostile to suggestions and the pay isn’t great.

pros: Ummm…. Fellow co-workers? Some are pretty okay
cons: Lol…. Where to begin about this job

job_title: Community Support Worker in Edmonton, AB
pros: loved working with this population of people
cons: do not get paid enough for what you do

job_title: Teacher, Elementary School in Edmonton, AB
pros: I found my strength in my hard work for this company.
cons: The work condition was poor. I was given very limited resources. I bought most of the resources out of my own pocket. Working environment is competitive rather than collaborative--every person for herself/ himself sorta speak. Early Childhood Managers were very cold and unsupportive! They lack the knowledge to understand what it means for an Early Childhood class to flourish!!! This has been the worst place that I've worked. This company needs to foster collaboration, team work and build trust before it can win the hearts of its clients and staffs!!!
Changeable policies and procedures without implementation trainings (2020) and without director's supervision for implementing policies and procedures

pros: Flexible hours, allows you to have a fantastic work life balance.  As it is part-time. Can be very understanding of personal issues.
cons: Not always sure of direction as it is a nonprofit and depended on funding.

job_title: Youth Support Worker in Edmonton, AB
pros: Very friendly and welcoming personnel. Everyone is given the opportunity to grow and share from job experiences. Also lots of relevant training.
cons: Non-Profit organization; depends largely on government funding and public donation, as a result, job retention may not be guaranteed due to funding fluctuations.

pros: The CEO will retire eventually. She is very old and out of touch.
cons: Uncaring management, the dirty and smelly building, invisible CEO, you have a very good chance of getting fired for no reason at all. the company is a revolving door.

pros: Front line staff are passionate about the demographic served.
cons:
Management is eager to change directions without thinking of the staff and placing them at risk personally. 
They profess to help vulnerable people but continue to place their staff in these positions.

pros: Saving some lives and able to give with positive feedback. Able to help with anyway possible.
cons: Dirty atmosphere. People hanging around by doorway. Used needles in bathrooms and their belongings.
